articles.description: Watch, follow and listen to action from the Third Round of the FA Cup.
articles.title: FA Cup LIVE: Watch Man City vs Salford City & follow scores & updates from third round

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound and follow live text coverage of Saturday's Scottish fixtures.
articles.title: Saturday's Scottish football - radio & text: BBC Sport

articles.title: European Champions Cup LIVE: Stormers v Sale, Exeter v Bordeaux, Munster v Saracens - radio commentary, live text and score updates

articles.description: David Moyes says it is "great to be back" after being appointed Everton manager for a second time.
articles.title: David Moyes named Everton manager for second time

articles.description: Two fans are banned from all Major League Baseball stadiums indefinitely after ripping the ball out of Los Angeles Dodgers fielder Mookie Betts' glove last year.
articles.title: MLB bans two fans indefinitely for ripping ball from Los Angeles Dodgers fielder Mookie Betts' glove

articles.description: Gael Monfils makes history by becoming the oldest winner of an ATP Tour singles title after triumphing at the ASB Classic in Auckland.
articles.title: Gael Monfils becomes oldest ATP Tour champion with Auckland win

articles.description: Liverpool enjoy a safe passage into the FA Cup fourth round with victory over Accrington Stanley at Anfield.
articles.title: Liverpool 4-0 Accrington Stanley: Federico Chiesa scores first Reds goal in third-round win

articles.description: Stormers cruise past Sale Sharks to claim a bonus-point victory and kickstart their Investec Champions Cup campaign in round three.
articles.title: Investec Champions Cup Stormers 40-0 Sale Sharks: South African side score six tries in comfortable win

articles.description: Celtic survive a scare at Ross County by producing a late burst of goals to stretch their lead at the Scottish Premiership summit to 18 points.
articles.title: Celtic beat Ross County with late spree to go 18 points clear

articles.description: The International Cricket Council should do more to support the Afghanistan women's team, says England captain Heather Knight.
articles.title: Heather Knight: ICC should do more to help Afghanistan women
